description: Distribution of first digit of mantissa following Benford's Law, using largest remainder method with Hare quotas.
links: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Benford's Law
example: a(50)=2 so that after 50 terms we have had 15 1's, 9 2's, 6 3's, 5 4's, 4 5's, 3 6's, 3 7's, 3 8's and 2 9's
author: _Henry Bottomley_, May 17 2000
